intro: Heliconia orthotricha, commonly known as the red heliconia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored inflorescences. The plant produces long, spiraled bracts that enclose numerous small, fragrant flowers. Its leaves are large, elongated, and often have a waxy texture. Heliconia orthotricha is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant appearance and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
